Internet of Things for Smart Industry Chapter 1 Welcome

Internet of Things for Smart Industry Franz Maurer, Witek ten Hove & Deny Smeets 2017-06-05 Chapter 1 Welcome This is an accompanying book to the HAN Minor Smart Industry and covers the major topics regarding the Internet of Things (IoT) implementation in an industrial setting.

Chapter 2 Introduction to IoT The IoT is the product of physical objects, controllers, sensors and actuators and the internet (McEwen and Cassimally 2013). The first reference to the IoT was in 1982, when researchers at Carnegie Mellon University developed the world’s first IoT-enabled Coke Machine. Mark Weiser developed the concept further in the early 90s; and Kevin Ashton coined the term ‘Internet of Things’ around 1999. References
